alert.note: Alert for La Salle (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 22 at 10:41AM CST until February 26 at 4:00AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Chicago IL has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Illinois... Illinois River at Ottawa affecting La Salle County. Illinois River at La Salle affecting Putnam, Bureau and La Salle Counties. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Illinois River from Heritage Harbor east of Ottawa downstream to Starved Rock Lock and Dam, including the Ottawa gauge. * WHEN...From Thursday evening to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 464.0 feet, Backwater causes the Fox River to reach bankfull near St. Elizabeth Medical Center in Ottawa. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 460.3 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 463.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. A Flood Watch means water levels above flood stage are possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Persons along rivers and streams in the watch area should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected by late tonight.
